content.description: FA not listed in the 95' guide. Please message and will update pertinent info. "Wingtip" 5.9+ PG. Go up the short and tricky crack. MP requires a star rating to submit, so 1 star has been given... More info is needed from climbers who have sent the route to get a precise star rating.
content.protection: Unable to provide specific gear recommendations. Route can likely be Top Roped like the rest of the lakeside routes.
content.location: Route is located approximately 20 feet right of "china dragon right." Wingtip is the furthest route on the right in the lakeside crag area.

content.description: Follow the slopping ramp with a crack from the left end of the crag heading up right to the rest ledge on Lakeside Jam (5.7).... Then, up the perfect and way too short finger crack above you to good solid holds for the top out....   Harder than it looks and more fun, too.... The climbing is cool, it's just over too quick....
content.location: Left end of the cliff up the crack/ramp to the finish crack....

content.description: Starting about 15" right of Lakeside Jam there are some crimps that lead directly up to a hanging dagger-like flake.  Once established on the flake, a bucket or two leads you to the lip for a fairly simple mantle.  Beta and flexibility make the crux (right off the ground) much easier.
content.protection: I suppose you could lead this, but the crux is right at the ground.  If you make it through the crux, you won't fall up higher.  Really this would be a better moderate-highball V3/4.  As it is a toprope is standard
content.location: About 15" right of Lakeside jam, this is the face immediately right of the left facing flake for "China Dragon Right).

content.description: On the left side of the cliff, there is a slabby face with cracks and holds making for an easy beginner route.... When I'm guiding and folks are having a hard time with the slippery climbs at the lower slab, I throw a rope down this and it gives them an easy way to make progress and learn a little about slab technique and cracks at the same time....

A very sweet addition to this crag.  Great gear, great movement, and an obvious line.  Start up the fingercrack of Swift Premium for a few moves until the crack of Babylon crosses your path and exits out left beneath a small roof.  Undercling the edge of the roof and make a crux reach to a good hold in the crack to your left.  Mantle out left and follow the crack to its end.
content.protection: Midsize cam placements aplenty.  Toprope off of trees.
content.location: This climbs the small roof on the left side of the crag.

content.description: The vertical line up the middle of the cliff.... Start on the twin cracks from the base, climb these to a good rest 10 to 15 feet off the ground.... Then, climb up and left to a ledge.... Rest again then up the offwidth to the finish.... The top is wide, so bring a big cam, run it out, or just top rope it....   Very fun if you know how to jam...hard if you don't....
content.protection: Reg rack plus a big cam for the top part....
content.location: The weakness right in the middle of the cliff....

climbs.name: Five Flakes Walk in to a Bar

content.description: A short face climb with plenty of flakes.  Start a few feet left of Scramble-rama with, you guessed it, a flake.  Follow the holds up and left until you reach the top.  Although not a bad climb, it would probably be better if it were longer.
content.location: On the far left side of the crag, to the left of Scramble-rama.  Scramble up tree roots from the base to reach the start.

content.description: Go up the face between china dragon and china dragon right. Finish on the last moves of china dragon. The 95' guidebook mentions "height related" so take that into consideration.Mp requires a star rating, so given 1 star. Route needs info from climbers who have sent route to get proper star rating.
content.location: Main area is lakeside crag. Chinese New year is between china dragon and china dragon right.

content.description:
This is another short route worth a run when the popular routes are taken or if you are entertaining a group on a busy day... 

  In my guidebook it is given 5.9 but the China Dragon finish is about the same difficulty as Lakeside Jam... The direct finish is harder so maybe they had that in mind... 

  A few steps right of the start of Lakeside/China Dragon there is a nice flake you can layback off the ground... A nice rest halfway up then either continue up left on another flake/crack to the top of Chins Dragons crack and on to the summit at 5.7... Or finish on an independent line straight up on a crack (harder)...
content.location: 10 feet right of China Dragon's start...

content.description:
Start up Lakeside Jam, then after the first rest break right up the right-angling crack, a few hard moves lead to a pretty good rest in a hand jam with good feet.... Then, another couple of hard moves in a desperate thin hand crack lead to a jug and more moderate climbing to the cliff top.... 

  Challenging crack climbing on nice rock with a nice setting by the pond.... Now, if we could do something about the bugs....
content.location: Starting in the middle of the cliff on Lakeside Jam then breaking right....

content.description: Face climb a couple feet left of Lakeside Jam. Use the arete for the first few feet. Then go left (not using the arete) and face climb up to the ledge. Once at the ledge, keep going up the center of the short face between the two cracks.MP requires a star rating, so given 1 star, route needs more info from climbers who have sent the route to get proper star rating. Also FA Unknown. If known please message and will update info.
content.location: main area is lakeside crag. Route Beam Me Up Scotty 5.11 TR. Located between Babylon and Lakeside Jam.

content.description: Bablyon climbs the shallow, left leaning crack to the left of Lakeside Jam.  Using sharp crimps and precise feet, work through the V4 boulder problem without any protection and gain the ledge at about the midpoint.  Plug some gear and finish up the finger crack on Swift Premium.  A sketchy lead for sure.
content.protection: Toprope from trees, or if leading, a few midsize cams (.5,.75,1) should protect the upper crack.  No pro down below.
content.location: This is the left leaning crack between Lakeside Jam and Swift Premium on the left side of the crag.  Rap off or walk off.

content.description: This is a small crag facing Round Pond.... A great collection of crack climbs of different grades.... The best ones are Lakeside Jam (5.7), and China Dragon (5.10).... This cliff is often overlooked by the hoards of people at the upper and lower cliffs....  Top ropes are easily set from pine trees at the top of the cliff....
